H0.text: Diet is the feature most likely inherited by a kitten from its parents.

H1.text: Color is the feature most likely inherited by a kitten from its parents.

H2.text: Health is the feature that a kitten is most likely to inherit from its parents.

H3.text: Independence is a feature that a kitten is most likely to inherit from its parents.

A4.text: A completely inactive gene for tyrosinase is found in albino cats, which causes a complete lack of dark pigmentation.

A5.text: About 250 heritable genetic disorders have been identified in cats, many similar to human inborn errors.

A6.text: If two parents are mated with each other who differ in one genetic characteristic for which they are both homozygous (each pure-bred), all offspring in the first generation (F1) are equal to the examined characteristic in genotype and phenotype showing the dominant trait.

A7.text: In humans, eye color is an example of an inherited characteristic: an individual might inherit the 'brown-eye trait' from one of the parents.

A8.text: If a mutation occurs within a gene, the new allele may affect the trait that the gene controls, altering the phenotype of the organism.
